org.openadaptor.auxil.convertor.xml
Class XmlToOrderedMapConvertor

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.core.Component
      org.openadaptor.auxil.convertor.AbstractConvertor
          org.openadaptor.auxil.convertor.xml.XmlToOrderedMapConvertor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, IComponent, IDataProcessor
public class XmlToOrderedMapConvertor
extends AbstractConvertor

This class may be used to convert XML Documents (dom4j/XML Strings) into OrderedMaps.

It achieves this by selecting the Elements of interest via an optional XPATH query and converts each Element recursively into Ordered Maps.

If no XPATH query is specified, the entire document is converted, resulting in a single ordered map, with a single entry whose name is the root tag, and whose value is the converted data.

Author:
Eddy Higgins

Parameters:

setOmitTopLevelElementTag

public void setOmitTopLevelElementTag(boolean omit)
If true, this means that each selected element will be converted into a single ordered map, with exactly one entry - the element tag as name, and the value is an ordered map with the elements under the root etc.

If false, then an ordered map will be returned containing all of the chidren. The default value is false (- this is to avoid losing data unexpectedly)

Parameters:
omit - true to return a single ordered map

getOmitTopLevelElementTag

public boolean getOmitTopLevelElementTag()
Returns:
true if the processed selection is wrapped inside an attribute naamed as the root node name.

setThrowRecordExceptionOnBadSelection

public void setThrowRecordExceptionOnBadSelection(boolean throwRecordExceptionOnBadSelection)
Toggle whether convertor will throw an exception if the XPath Selection fails to select Nodes. Default is false.

Parameters:
throwRecordExceptionOnBadSelection -

getThrowRecordExceptionOnBadSelection

public boolean getThrowRecordExceptionOnBadSelection()
Returns:
true if an exception is to be thrown when an XPath selection fails.

getStoreXMLInAttributeName

public java.lang.String getStoreXMLInAttributeName()
Returns:
the name of the attribute used to store the incoming XML in or null.

setStoreXMLInAttributeName

public void setStoreXMLInAttributeName(java.lang.String storeXMLInAttributeName)
If set then an attribute (as per the supplied name) will be added to the root of the outgoing OrderedMap. It will contain the string representation of the incoming XML. Defaults to null which means that the XML is NOT be added to the OrderedMap.

Warning: no effort is made to check if the attribute exists already. That is left for the user to arrange.

Parameters:
storeXMLInAttributeName - the name of the attribute to create

convert

protected java.lang.Object convert(java.lang.Object record)
                            throws RecordException
Converts the supplied DOM document or XML String into an ordered map(s). If the xpathExpression property is set then this is used to select the elements to be converted. Otherwise the entire document is used.

Specified by:
convert in class AbstractConvertor
Parameters:
record - containing an XML Document (dom4j) or a String containing an XML Document
Returns:
Data from the document, converted into OrderedMap, or OrderedMap[] or null
Throws:
RecordException - if conversion fails
RecordFormatException - if the record is not a String or a Document
See Also:
Dom4jUtils
